derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French marle, from medieval Latin margila, from Latin marga, of Celtic origin

means.word_mean: 1. a loose and crumbling earthy deposit consisting mainly of calcite or dolomite; used as a fertilizer for soils deficient in lime

auth_sentence.content: Fields which have been overspread with lime, burnt marl, or cinder, become, in time, covered by finely-divided soil.

auth_sentence.content: The soil consists of a chalk subsoil, topped by a covering of rubble that is made up of sand, lignite, marl, loam and clay.
